metadata.Title: CVE-2016-0702 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
The MOD_EXP_CTIME_COPY_FROM_PREBUF function in crypto/bn/bn_exp.c inOpenSSL 1.0.1 before 1.0.1s and 1.0.2 before 1.0.2g does not properlyconsider cache-bank access times during modular exponentiation, which makesit easier for local users to discover RSA keys by running a craftedapplication on the same Intel Sandy Bridge CPU core as a victim andleveraging cache-bank conflicts, aka a "CacheBleed" attack.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-0702` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.18
openssl - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.18
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssl package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.18').
openssl098: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
